memberdef.name: pci_device_class
memberdef.initializer: = { "Unknown", "Mass Storage Controller", "Network Controller", "Display Controller", "Multimedia Controller", "Memory Controller", "Bridge Device", "Simple Communication Controller", "Base System Peripheral", "Input Device", "Docking Station", "Processor", "Serial Bus Controller", "Wireless Controller", "Intelligent I/O Controller", "Satellite Communication Controller", "Encryption/Decryption Controller", "Data Acquisition/Signal Processing Controller" }

briefdescription.para: Enable bus mastering on a PCI device.

simplesect.para: True if bus mastering was newly enabled, false if already set.

briefdescription.para: Test whether a device descriptor represents 'not found'.

simplesect.para: True if no device, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the type of a PCI Base Address Register (BAR).
Extract an I/O base address from a BAR.
Extract a memory base address from a BAR.
Read a value from a PCI configuration space field.

simplesect.para: The value read (size determined by field).

briefdescription.para: Write a value into a PCI configuration space field.

parameterdescription.para: Value to write (size determined by field).

briefdescription.para: Get the PCI device class/subclass identifier.
Get the secondary bus number from a PCI bridge device.
Determine if the device is a single-function endpoint.

simplesect.para: Non-zero if endpoint, zero if multifunction/bridge.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t vendor_id, uint16_t device_id, uint32_t bus, uint32_t device, uint32_t function, int device_type)
memberdef.name: pci_scan_function

briefdescription.para: Scan a specific PCI function for matching IDs or type.

simplesect.para: Matching PCI device or dev_zero if none.

briefdescription.para: Get a list of all enumerated PCI devices.

simplesect.para: Number of devices in the list.

briefdescription.para: Display enumerated PCI devices to the system log.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t vendor_id, uint16_t device_id, uint32_t bus, uint32_t device, int device_type)
memberdef.name: pci_scan_device

briefdescription.para: Scan all functions of a given PCI device slot.

simplesect.para: Matching PCI device or dev_zero if none.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t vendor_id, uint16_t device_id, uint32_t bus, int device_type)
memberdef.name: pci_scan_bus

briefdescription.para: Scan all devices on a given PCI bus.

simplesect.para: First matching PCI device or dev_zero if none.

briefdescription.para: Find a device by vendor, device, or type.

simplesect.para: Matching PCI device or dev_zero if none.

briefdescription.para: Initialise the PCI subsystem and enumerate devices.
Enable or disable legacy INTx interrupt signalling.
Enable MSI (Message Signalled Interrupts) on a device.

parameterdescription.para: local APIC ID of the CPU to route the vector to

simplesect.para: True if MSI was enabled successfully.

memberdef.argsstring: (pci_dev_t device, uint32_t vector, uint16_t entry, uint32_t lapic_id)
memberdef.name: pci_enable_msix

briefdescription.para: Enable MSI-X (extended message signalled interrupts).

parameterdescription.para: local APIC ID of the CPU to route the vector to

simplesect.para: True if MSI-X was enabled successfully.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, pci_dev_t dev, uint8_t logical_cpu_id, isr_t handler, void *context)
memberdef.name: pci_setup_interrupt

briefdescription.para: Configure an interrupt for a PCI device (MSI/MSI-X if available).

detaileddescription.para: Attempts to enable MSI/MSI-X for the given PCI device, routing the interrupt to the specified Local APIC ID. If the device does not support MSI/MSI-X, falls back to legacy INTx routing.

parameterdescription.para: Human-readable device name (used in logs/debug output).
Logical CPU ID of the target CPU that should receive the interrupt.
Opaque pointer passed to the ISR when the interrupt fires.

simplesect.para: The lapic_id parameter must be a valid logical ID corresponding to an online CPU. Passing an invalid or offline CPU ID will result in undefined behaviour and may cause interrupts to be lost.
The assigned interrupt vector (64255 if MSI/MSI-X was used, or IRQ_START + line if falling back to legacy INTx).
Drivers should always check the returned vector to confirm which interrupt mechanism was actually configured.
